title: I don't care what anyone says - Elo Hell is real and carrying in Silver is harder then Plat+
body:
Attempting to carry my 3rd level 30 account out of silver and boy what a clown fiesta ride!

1. At higher Elo - You can trust your team. 
Not so in Silver.

2. At higher Elo - If your plaT+ laner dies twice he (usually) puts the breaks on his aggresion and tries to stop the snowball - at the cost of cs'ing under tower and maybe even giving up a tower.
Not so in Silver. In Silver it isn't uncommon at all to come out of laning phase with a laner who went 0-7 and is STILL trying to 1v1 his lane opponent.

3. At higher Elo - people understand the mid game mechanics and the importance of vision and ward control.
Not so in Silver. It isn't uncommon for right after laning phase for a clown fiesta of deaths to appear and one character quickly gain 10+ "gimmie" kills immediately after laning phase.

4. At higher Elo - Global objectives are prioritized.
Not so in Silver. It isn't uncommon to see 5 people chase a kill over half a map and then run into respawns and wipe.

Anyone care to prove me wrong? Playing in silver is like a completely new gamestyle. Clown Fiesta Style.

Prove me wrong. Take a look.
